co.cask.cdap.api.service.http

Class HttpContentProducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.api.service.http.HttpContentProducer

  • public abstract class HttpContentProducer
extends Object
    Instance of this class is for producing an HTTP response body in small chunks to avoid running out of memory when responding with a large body. An instance of this class can be provided to one of the send methods in HttpServiceResponder.

    • Constructor Summary

      HttpContentProducer()

      This method will get invoked after the last chunk of data is sent.

      • HttpContentProducer

    • Method Detail

      • getContentLength

        public long getContentLength()
        Returns the length of the content or -1L if the length is unknown.

      • nextChunk

        public abstract ByteBuffer nextChunk(Transactional transactional)
                              throws Exception
        This method provides a new chunk of data to be sent to the client. It is guaranteed that no concurrent calls to this method will be made. The implementation can reuse the same ByteBuffer instance across multiple calls to this method.

        Access to transactional Datasets must be done through the Transactional.execute(TxRunnable) method.

        Parameters:
        transactional - for executing a TxRunnable in a single transaction.
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer containing the next chunk of bytes to be sent to the client. If the returned ByteBuffer is empty (Buffer.hasRemaining() == false), it signals that's the end of the response body.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is any error

      • onFinish

        public abstract void onFinish()
                       throws Exception
        This method will get invoked after the last chunk of data is sent. It is always executed inside a single transaction.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is any error

      • onError

        public abstract void onError(Throwable failureCause)
        This method will get invoked when there is an error while sending body chunks. Any issues related to network as well as any Exceptions raised from either nextChunk(Transactional) or onFinish() methods will have this method invoked. This method is always executed inside a single transaction.
        Parameters:
        failureCause - the reason of the failure
